snippet: There are still more people than usual who are involuntarily working part time, or who have given up on the job market.
abstract: Labor market remains weaker than last time unemployment stood at 6.1 percent, in September of 2008; difference appears to be so-called shadow unemployment, with more people than usual involuntarily working part time because they are unable to find full-time work.
lead_paragraph: There are still more people than usual who are involuntarily working part time, or who have given up on the job market.

headline.main: What About the Jobless Who Aren’t Looking?
